title: Bushmills to Giant's Causeway Walk Route

images.title: Train near Bushmills (3) by Albert Bridge, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Train near Bushmills. The Giant's Causeway and Bushmills Railway is a 3 ft narrow gauge heritage railway operating between the Giant's Causeway and Bushmills. The line is two miles long.

images.title: Giant's Causeway & Bushmills Railway by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Railway path

images.title: View southwards along the Giant's Causeway and Bushmills Tramway and Cycle Track by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View southwards along the Giant's Causeway and Bushmills Tramway and Cycle Track

images.title: JoachimKohler-HB, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Giant's Causeway

description: This walk takes you from the village of Bushmills to the Giant's Causeway on the coast of County Antrim, Northern Ireland. The route links two of the major attractions in the area - you can visit the splendid Bushmills Whiskey Distillery and then enjoy a short walk to the spectacular Causeway coast. The trail heads north from the village, passing alongside the old Bushmills Railway. It's a surfaced path so easy walking and also suitable for cyclists. Along the way you can also enjoy some fine views of the surrounding countryside before coming the coastal section with its wondeful rock formations. You can return along the same path or catch the heritage train if you prefer.
